meanings.definition: A residential institution for the care and education of orphans.
meanings.sent1: The orphanage provided a safe place for children without parents.
meanings.sent2: She visited the orphanage to donate toys to the children.
meanings.sent3: The orphanage was so full of laughter and play, it felt like a big family.
meanings.sent4: In the heart of the city, the orphanage stood as a beacon of hope for the community.
meanings.sent5: The colorful walls of the orphanage made it a cheerful place for the kids.

meanings.definition: The condition of being an orphan.
meanings.sent1: Growing up in an orphanage meant not having parents around.
meanings.sent2: The orphanage helped children cope with the sadness of their orphanhood.
meanings.sent3: Despite his orphanage, he found joy in the friendships he made.
meanings.sent4: Her orphanage was like a badge of honor, showing her strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of orphanage made him cherish the bonds he formed with others.
